solution_line_template: Each dog eats {food_per_feeding} x {feedings_per_day} = <<{food_per_feeding}*{feedings_per_day}={daily_food_per_dog}>>{daily_food_per_dog} pound of dog food each day.
So the {num_dogs} dogs eat a total of {daily_food_per_dog} x {num_dogs} = <<{daily_food_per_dog}*{num_dogs}={total_daily_food}>>{total_daily_food} pounds each day.
That is {total_daily_food} x {days_per_week} = <<{total_daily_food}*{days_per_week}={weekly_food_consumption}>>{weekly_food_consumption} pounds in a week.
Therefore, {initial_food_bought} - {weekly_food_consumption} = <<{initial_food_bought}-{weekly_food_consumption}={food_left}>>{food_left} pounds of food are left after a week.
